topic.title: Domain List
topic.p: The Domain List displays all domain administrators that are currently configured on your server.

section-list.title: Features of the Domain List Section

ol.title: To view the Domain List:
ol.li: On the Control Panel home page, under Domain Management, click Domain List. The Domain List window appears.
From the “Display Domains of” drop-down list, select the domain administrator who owns the domains you want to view.
Click Go. The Domain List window refreshes displaying a list of the domains administered by the selected domain administrator.

ol.title: To add a domain:
ol.li: On the Control Panel home page, click Add Domain. The Add Domain Setup window appears.
Next to Domain Admin, from the Add the domain to the following user drop-down list, select the user who will be the domain administrator for this domain.

Next to Domain, type the new domain name.
Note: After a domain is added, the domain name cannot be changed.
Next to Web Services, select the web services you want. Enabling CGI permits CGI scripts in the domain's cgi-bin directory. Enabling SSL permits secure HTTPS connection using a shared certificate.
Next to End Users, type the number of end users you want to allow the domain administrator to create.
Next to Email Addresses, type the number of email addresses you want to allow the domain administrator to create.
Next to Website Logs, select the Website log options you want.
Next to Domain Contact, type the email address of the person to be contacted if error messages are generated for the domain.

Next to Mail Catchall, select the option you want. If you want catchall mail delivered to a specific address, select Deliver mail to and type that address in the Deliver mail to field.
Note: If you type multiple addresses, separate each one with a comma.

When you are finished, click Next. The Add Domain Preview window appears displaying the options you have selected for this domain. To make any changes, click Previous, make the desired changes, then click Next to go to the Preview window.

Click Save/Create Another, if you want to add another domain. A message appears confirming that the domain has been added and the window refreshes with blank fields. Click Save if you do not want to add another domain at this time. A message appears confirming that the domain has been added.

ol.title: To edit a domain:
ol.li: On the Control Panel home page, click Domain List. The Domains window appears.
In the Actions column, click properties for the domain you want to edit. The Properties window for the selected domain appears.
Next to Domain Setup, click Edit. The Edit Domain Setup window for the selected domain appears.
Next to Domain, you can select to disable or enable this domain's alias.

Next to Web Services, select the web services you want to enable. Enabling CGI permits CGI scripts in the domain's cgi-bin directory. Enabling SSL permits secure HTTPS connection using a shared certificate.
Next to End Users, select the number of end users you want to allow the domain administrator to create.
Next to Email Addresses, select the number of email addresses you want to allow the domain administrator to create.
Next to Website Logs, select the Website log options you want.
Next to Domain Contact, type the email address of the person to be contacted if error messages are generated for the domain (generally this is the domain administrator).

Next to Mail Catchall, select the option you want. If you want catchall mail delivered to a specific address, select Deliver mail to and type that address in the Deliver mail to field.
Note: If you type multiple addresses, separate each one with a comma.
Click Save. A message appears confirming that the domain has been changed.

ol.title: To delete a domain:
ol.li:
On the Control Panel home page, under Domain Management, select Domain List. The Domains window appears.
Note: Before you can delete a domain, you must delete all accounts configured under it. Deleting a domain administrator account permanently removes all that domain administrator’s information and mail from the server.
In the Actions column, click delete for the domain you want to delete. A message appears asking if you are sure you want to delete this domain.
Click OK. The window refreshes with that domain deleted from the list and a message informing you that the selected domain has been deleted.

ol.title: To disable a domain:
ol.li:
On the Control Panel home page, under Domain Management, select Domain List. The Domains window appears.
Note: Disabling a domain account temporarily freezes the account. The users’ settings and mail are not deleted. While in a disabled state, all users (domain administrator and End Users) associated with this domain are unable to retrieve mail or access the account through the Control Panel, FTP, or shell.
In the Actions column, click disable for the domain you want to disable. A message appears asking if you are sure you want to disable this domain.
Click OK. The window refreshes with a message informing you that the selected domain has been disabled. The word "disabled" appears in the Status column for that domain.

ol.title: To enable a domain:
ol.li: On the Control Panel home page, under Domain Management, select Domain List. The Domains window appears.

In the Actions column, click enable for the domain you want to enable. The window refreshes with a message informing you that the selected domain has been disabled. The word "enabled" appears in the Status column for that domain.
